terms.definition: A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a vendor and accessed via the internet
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to revert to previous versions and track modifications
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, providing transparency and accountability
A system that stores all documents in a single, accessible location rather than scattered across multiple folders or systems
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously work on and edit documents with changes visible instantly to all participants
The process of generating reports automatically using predefined templates and data sources without manual intervention
A pre-designed document format that provides a standardized structure for creating consistent reports or documentation
Records and documents that demonstrate adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, or internal policies
The process of involving and communicating with individuals or groups who have an interest in or are affected by business operations
An independent evaluation conducted by an external organization to verify compliance, processes, or documentation accuracy
Cooperation between different departments or teams within an organization to achieve common goals
The practice of documenting and communicating an organization's environmental, social, and economic impacts and performance
The process of searching for and accessing specific documents from a storage system or database
The ability to track and verify the history, location, and changes of documents or data throughout their lifecycle
